channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Large, deep pothole in centre of road, 10th August
item.description:
This pothole has been here for some time and has got progressively worse. It is between both lanes and is directly on the tyre line of vehicles turning left from Bridge Road onto Northend Road. It is now so deep that it affects the stability of motorcycles turning left and will result in a motorcyclist coming off if it is not repaired due to its location. As it is directly on the tyre line when turning motorcycles are made unstable whilst turning and travelling over the defect
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Northend Road, North End, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Fly tipping, 10th August
item.description:
Household waster dumped next to bins. Not put in the bins. Educate people on how to properly throw rubbish and recycling away - simply put it in a bin.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Pownall Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Blocked Gully Drain, 10th August
item.description:
The drain is now completely blocked with water not flowing through it. There’s so much soil and sediment that a tree is growing out of it. There’s a risk of flooding to the adjacent residential property.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 1-10, Thicket Grove, Crystal Palace, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Tfl to note this can be reported here see your own website!! please action a resolution rather than keep passing the buck. Gtreenwich Council say Tfl are responsible for this issue. You can Streetcare to report any of the issues or concerns on this list. " On roads: traffic signals that are damaged or not working properly". Traffic lights not working properly are a safety issue. Traffic from Southwood road are released on a green traffic light in direct conflict with traffic from the west on the Sidcup Road A20 turning right into Green Lane. Accidents have happened are continue as this is a serious safety issue. Please fix - Thank you., 10th August
item.description:
Tfl to note this can be reported here see your own website!! please action a resolution rather than keep passing the buck. Gtreenwich Council say Tfl are responsible for this issue. You can Streetcare to report any of the issues or concerns on this list. " On roads: traffic signals that are damaged or not working properly". Traffic lights not working properly are a safety issue. Traffic from Southwood road are released on a green traffic light in direct conflict with traffic from the west on the Sidcup Road A20 turning right into Green Lane. Accidents have happened are continue as this is a serious safety issue. Please fix - Thank you.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Southwood Road, New Eltham, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Regular problem of residents rubbish /bags with added loose waste /pallet on pavement, 10th August
item.description:
This piling of rubbish on the pavement has been occurring every week for 5 months or more. It’s unsightly - a hazard to health and obstructs pavement The bin store for these flats is there but not used . Traders report a letter from RBG pinned up inside the foyer stating council “wants it like this …..”

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 226, Trafalgar Road, East Greenwich, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Weeds on pathways and curb sides near the roads are a disgrace this needs to be done every Two weeks, 10th August
item.description:
As you look down each street the weeds are getting higher and higher! They need to be killed and dug out! I do my front garden to make the street look nice! What’s happened to Lewisham council?

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Billington Road, New Cross Gate, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Fly tipping from Academy Apartments, 10th August
item.description:

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Institute Place, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: 8 x rubbish bags full of nitrous oxide containers dumped, 10th August
item.description:
We witnessed 4 x individuals dumping the rubbish sacks full of nitrous oxide canisters (and balloons etc) behind the electrical cupboard opposite 29 Regency Way and in the alleyway next to 48 Regency Way by the garages. The vehicle photographed picked up one of the females who dumped the bags. There were two females and two males approximately 20 years old and the driver was a white male approximately 40 years old. This has happened before in the same location. This was at 09:40-09:43 on Sunday 10/08/25

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Regency Way, Blendon, London
Report on FixMyStreet
